content:
er 5, 2013
												If you count the time before it's Steam release, I think I've been playing this game for a couple thousand hours. First of all: The game is still called a "Beta", because the developers plan to add even more content in the future and don't want to call it a "full" game, yet. It is not some bug-haunted piece of software without any content to it, if you are afraid about that. Secondly: You don't need to own any Source engine game to play PVKII. Just go to the Steam Store and start downloading it!And as a third point: Some negative reviews criticized the unrealistic damage displayed for some attacks. The damage display is a plugin for "SourceMod" and has nothing to do with the PVKII base game. It is known that this plugin is not optimized for PVKII and sometimes displays improper damage. Therefore, most people use it only as a "hit detector" on certain servers.Speaking of the game itself: It has so much love in it, you can see it everywhere: The voice acting is one of the best I've seen in a game - even retail ones. The voices and the beautifully crafted, slightly comic-styled models give each class a real "personality". The design of the stock maps fits the game's theme perfectly and the community has created a lot of good custom maps so far.I have to admit that the population in the game is not the biggest, but it is always possible to find a full server or fill one quickly. The learning curve is steep and you will encounter many good players with hundreds or thousands of hours play time. While this could be frustrating for new players, it keeps the fights always challenging. In the end, the game is all about team play and even good players might not be able to win a game against a team working together really well.The last thing I want to mention here is the rate of updates: There aren't as many updates as in other games, but it already takes quite some time to get into the game. You have to practice with each class for a while to be good with it. Creating classes and doing other major updates takes time. Especially since classes are not random models, but - as I mentioned before - real personalities and have a lot of references to literature and movies. There is also a lot of actual play testing by experienced beta testers involved before a release. This means that none of the updates has brought any balance problems with it so far. It always became better and each new class has been integrated really well.I can only recommend to try out this game and want to thank everyone for reading my review!

content:
, 2015
												Pros:Really good voice acting for a free mod.Lots of unquie classes, each team has a unquie class instead of being re-colours like in TF2.A lot of gamemodes.Lovely maps and are well designed.Achievements can sometimes give you Parrot colours and titles! Like for an example "Joe The Brave" or "Fred The Coward."The Sniper classes are easily some of the most balanced in gaming, their attacks are effected by gravity and are very vulnerable to attacks. Lots of maps and custom gamemodes from the community!Easily the best free mod on steam.Cons:Source Engine, hitboxes are awful as usual, however PVK2 has the best Hit detection of all Source Engine multiplayer games. Still it's unfair when the Skirmisher's pistol can't hit sh*t when shooting someone 1 foot infront of you while an axe slashes your head off 200 miles away.Due to how hard it is to learn this game and how unknown this game is, the playerbase is rather small, unless a Major update comes out.Teams can be horribly unbalanced depending which map you play on, in an area where there are lots of Pitfalls, Vikings will dominate, while more tighter areas make Knights very deadly, the only map where this doesn't happen often is Bt_Island which is one of the most played maps in the game.Updates are slow because the Dev team is small and works on a game FOR FREE! You can donate at their offical website if you want to give a bit of money!http://www.octosharkstudios.com/pvkii/Also even though they take a long time to update, the actual updates are much higher quality then most games I play, they often add lots of new maps, balance changes, tons of bug fixes and more! Plus it's rare a new game changing bug is introduced, the only bad glitch I can think of is when on Island you can get into the Viking spawn, but even then that isn't as bad as other glitches since you or they cannot attack you. However what annoys me is when you compare this small awesome company/Dev Team to a larger company like Valve, look at TF2, makes millions a day, most updates are either g*mped of content like EOTL or massive cashcows like the Robotic Boogaloo update and even the best update of 2015 Gun Mettle which makes all the other cashcow updates look like nothing, plus TF2 is still full with glitches, so much infact that it  makes Ride To Hell look polished sometimes. Sorry for the rant, but like I said I hate it when I compare a small company which makes next to no money and makes a much more polished game, then a large company which makes millions and don't want to fix all the major issues with the game 90% of the time.Well anyhow PVK2 is a very hard game to learn, however once you learn it, it's one of the best FPS on steam and I highly recommend this game to anyone.

r 28, 2015
												Short Version:Play this game now. 100% Free. Great fun!//Rant Below//Lets put it this way. I've always played games that have sandbox elements, guns, good old outer space, and had plenty of modding.Lets begin with the games description."you'll find this game both hilarious and exhilarating."This is not a lie. You will be laughing at how hard you will probably fail, how crazy the classes are, the voice lines, and practically everything about this game."I like guns" - COD KIDGuess what COD kid? There is actually a good deal of ranged weapons. You will still contribute with these intresting variety of weapons to hit people from a distance. Its not just bows and arrows. Heck you got a pistol and a rifle as a sharpshooter. Sure its old, but it is still a gun. You like having stuff kill people for you? Play as pirate captain and send your trusty old attack parrot after em.You like chopping people up? I've never seen so many ways to obliterate people with swords. Sword play is quite well done for a source game. Its incredible actually.You even have specials for the classes. Seriously this game is 10/10.This game is not fun to watch as it is to play. Play it now! Seriously.... do it! If you like the video on the store page you will probably like this game. If you did not you might still like this game. Watching that video does not do this game justice of how fun actually playing it is.Lets get this straight. IT IS NOT A FREE TO PLAY! IT IS FREE! There is a difference between those. This game is 100% FREE. There is absolutely nothing to lose by playing this game! There is no in game store and it would not ask for anything from you.THERE IS NOTHING TO LOSE! In TF2 you try to get stupid hats and everyone can outclass you with money. This game you JUST play. Nothing else. You enjoy and have fun. No more euphoric top hat scouts. Just play this as it is what tf2 should have been.Not a single dollar will need to be spent for this game.The developers are truely great and I thank them for making a truely wonderful free game.Please play this game now!

content:
er 26, 2014
												tl;dr - 9.5/10 game.Breakdown:Media (Audio/Graphics/Programming):The game is visually pleasing. There may be a few small clips or graphical problems, but the game runs very smooth, since it does not have fancy shaders or modeling. Audio is fine. Background music is satisfactory, and the sound effects are very good.Idea (Mechanics/Balancing/Marketing): PVKII is a VERY good idea. As the title states, it is a three team battle. Pirates VS Vikings VS Knights. All the teams have three classes, which normally are: Ranger, Melee, and a medium-ranged fighter. The game is well-balanced, with many counter attacks you can make against other players. The community is amazing! The developers are awesome!Fun:PVKII is a FREE game. It's not filled to the brim with microtransactions like other "free" games. In fact, there is nothing to buy. (except HL2 to play the mod ) The game is very fun. Instead of your normal two team fighting game, this game is perfect for groups with multiples of three. If you have lopsided teams in other games, try PVKII with friends! All the classes are unique, along with the teams.Overall: Amazing, truly FREE game. Very fun three team fighting game! Developers are cool, and the game is amazing! The game itself runs very smooth, with a sacrifice of polycount. (but in an intense fight, you wouldn't care, and it's not THAT noticable as other games) Buy it when it goes on sa-... wait... it's free! If you do not have the original game (HL2), BUY IT NOW. Play HL2 through, and then play PVKII.The only drawback is the small community. Otherwise, this game is perfect. You probably want to play with friends though, so you can find people to play with.9.5/10.

r 31, 2014
												Pirates, Vikings & Knights is a great multiplayer mod for Half Life 2. Gameplay is simple; Choose your faction: Pirates, Vikings and .... well you probably couldn't guess but you can also pick Knights, then you pick one of the 4 classes and start killing each other. So you got 12 different classes, each with his own skills, strengths and weaknessess. The main game mode is trying to grab treasure chests and try to keep them in your base untill the time expires, obviously the other factions will try to steal them from you. Ofcourse you also got (T)DM if that's more to your liking.Pirates, Vikings and Knights II takes a funny approach to Multiplayer Deathmatches and it will probably enjoy you for many hours. Besides it's free if you own Half Life 2, so why not give it a try ?

content:
r 18, 2015
												Pirates, Vikings and Knights II is a game with amazing potential. Currently, though incomplete, it can still be played and enjoyed as a solid version of the full game, albeit with limited classes.  However, right now the classes are: Berserker, Huscarl and Gestir on Vikings; Heavy Knight, Archer and Man-at-Arms on Knights; and Skirmisher, Captain and Sharpshooter on Pirates.  So they do have at least 3 per team, and it is more varied than previous versions.  One downside has been the long wait for each new class, but the vast majority of players are grateful for what they get, and rightfully so because it has always been a free mod.  The gameplay was always solid, so for it's time it deserves a lot of credit.  It's unfortunate that it hasn't been greenlighted on Steam.  I'll need to look into that.I recommend PVKII if you're familiar with games like Oblivion/Skyrim, Chivalry, or any Half-Life 2 games in particular.  Beyond that, any FPS player out there is perfect, as the main perspective is first-person.  The action is very fast paced and accuracy and timing oriented.  There's plenty of interesting custom maps on those servers as well when the core maps become familiar, though the core maps tend to be higher quality than custom.  It's a game to have fun in and adapt to the physics and movement limitations.  You can dodge arrows and feint in battle to dodge and counter their attack.  You can throw a keg and shoot it with your pistol as a Skirmisher and have it explode immediately. (This is dangerous though, you're likely to hit it closer and that may be suicidal. But it's hilarious.)  Every class has it's own style and you can figure out how to best utilize their advantages while adjusting for their disadvantages.  I suggest embracing their disadvantages -- for example, as a Heavy Knight, it's easier to let them come to you.  When you aren't constantly moving while they're moving, they won't see your relative speed, so when you do move to dodge their attack they likely won't be able to adjust in time.  A charged attack from a Heavy Knight does the most damage when used accurately.  Heavy Knights deserve credit because they have the hardest time getting food to restore health, as they run the slowest by far of any class in the game, due to balancing their Attack with Health/Armor and Attack Speed/Movement Speed.Skirmishers can also die in two hits from a Heavy Knight's Great Sword, or three hits from a Two-handed Axe, and all depending on how Charged and accurate the attack was.  Skirmishers, however, run the fastest. Due to the WASD movement you can move in and out to attack, dodge, or feint (have them swing, you dodge, then counter). A Skirmisher is able to move backwards faster than most classes run forwards.  Thus, if you can time it, you can theoretically avoid every attack.  There tends to be a split second where they are in reach, so you'll want to Charge your attack around a corner, and hearing his footsteps, you move forward and swing towards him.  Otherwise, use Taunt and maybe they'll want to cut you to ribbons.  Then you just allow yourself to get hit and attack them as they can't dodge.  The Heavy Knight blocks slowly, and has a long attack delay, but if you can manage it you should Parry and Counter a Skirmisher because it usually results in a death if they have already engaged in battle.  It's a quick finisher that makes the Heavy Knight more into a Samurai for that moment.  Don't try it too much if they know to just Charge their attack so as not to get Parried, however.  Then you have to absorb their attack to hit them, if they're skilled in weaving their movement and much faster.  A Viking Huscarl and Pirate Captain could even out-maneuver a Heavy Knight.Above all, you'll want to support your team with Encourage or have some fun over the mic, and try to work together to bring down the enemy teams.  The most important thing in PVK is teamwork.  We all like to mess around and have fun, but when you want to win because the same guy has been winning the last three rounds in a row and is a total d-bag about it, all you gotta do is move in one big group and swing away.  As long as you don't get distracted or separated, you should be akin to a tank with rotating sawblades.  I'm looking at you, Vikings.  Pirates, you gotta run away.  But just long enough to come back and throw eight kegs at the Vikings and Knights who are fighting each other and desperately want to get that kill point from the guy they were just fighting, so they'll let you throw the keg and try to jump away at the last second. But you won't let that happen.  You wait til the wick of the keg is just barely sticking out, one second away from exploding, and you run forward, jump and throw it slightly up so as to fall in the middle of the most fighters in proximity to the keg's explosion, and you in one instant take 4 kills for you and your team.  That, or you and your teammates kegs end up littering the battlefield and clearing everyone out in turn.  Knights, your archers will want to kill a Skirmisher in two hits using one shot from the Crossbow and one shot from their Longbow.  Several archers can nail a Skirmisher if they're accurate and the skirmisher likely has their keg out and moves slower.  Archers, you still do the most damage with your Crossbow and Longbow, so you should try to be like Legolas and shoot people point blank if they get too close.  You can learn to utilize your Shortsword in time, but as it's shorter and weaker than other light weapons, it should be taken into consideration you'll have to work harder to kill with that than as any other class.  Unless the enemy has low health, using this is only for advanced players.  Much like the Sharpshooter's knife or the Captain's hook and fist. Though I would say the Shortsword isn't half bad, either.  It's fun to play Archer with Shortsword because the enemy tends to expect an easy kill.  You can avoid their hits (you'd better) and weaken them, then do a ton of damage with a point-blank Crossbow bolt and usually finish them then.  There's many ways to play, and I could go on.Most importantly, the gameplay is innovative and has the most control out of any other game.  I look forward to future updates, but I also hope more developers see the potential in this style of gameplay.  The dev team deserves to be picked up and paid to create.

content:
er 13, 2013
												Sadly, the game is passed its prime. There are too many similar and complete games out right now to justify pvkii. I put several hundred hours into this game; I LOVED this game, but I simply can't bring myself to get back into it. The most disappointing facet about this game is the level of support the game has gotten.I get it, games take time, money and energy to make. It's a fact that probably doesn't get noticed nearly enough these games. The game has been out for over half a decade now and still has not managed to release half of the classes that were planned from the beginning. Each update has become more and more underwhelming as time goes on. When the game first came out, there was only one class per team. They were unbalanced and buggy, but they had personality and synergised well together. Later updates brought variety, engagement and even a complete overhauls of game mechanics. The game began a bit of a decent by the release of 2.3, which is a bit odd for me to say because i probably had the most fun during 2.3. 2.3 brought a new class, an updated engine and multiple bug fixes, but it had one flaw. 2.3  allowed player to choose between a manual and automatic block function. This may not seem like much to someone looking in from the outside, but modern game communities are finicky about the games that they've put so many hours into. Imagine, if you will, a game suck as Counter-strike 1.6 added some sort of option that reduced the amount of damage that a headshot inflicted; but, at the same time, increased how much damage a body shot would do. This would drasticly reduce the learning curve for new players, while leaving the game unaltered for the die hard veterans that have been eating and breathing this game for the past decade. You could balance the damage figures perfectly and draw all of the graphs you wanted, but the veterans are not going to like the fact that the skills they have honed have now been made slightly less effective so that some filthy pesant  with a brand new copy can feel accomplished. A small change that forever alters the way that the game is seen. Manual blocking was still the default option, even preferred by some of those old pvkii vets, but auto-block gave new players an arguably unearned and uneven playing field. This seemingly insignificant change drove a spike through the community.And this brings me to the a very taboo topic in pvkii. The "community." Some will tell you that the community is in ashes. Some will tell you that the community is just fine. All can agree on the same thing, the community has gotten SMALLER. I, personally, won't be going into the specifics about the sociology behind the pvkii community because i wouldn't be able to progress beyond a ramble that leads to nothing productive. Instead, I'll bring up the previously mentioned issue, the spike that drove the community apart. Modern gaming is leaning towards a sort of bipartisan: "Core" gamers and "Casual" gamers. "Veterans" and "Noobs." "People that play more than me" and "People that play less than me." "12 years olds" and "12 year olds." The core guys bring stability to the community and the new comers bring life. Neither are perfect but both are vital. When the barely sentient guy that just installed the game manages to get a lucky hit on someone who has the pvkii logo tattooed on his forehead for so long that the ink is starting to seep into his brain and cause mood swings, two things happen. One: the new guy tells his friends, they tell their friends, who tell their friends and so on until, you got a reputable pack of these little poobrains wobbling about mashing the m1 button so hard that Razor's share holders are starting to get nervous and Two: the hardcore players lock themselves away in a single server so that they can beat each other over the head with their erect ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and talk about how good they are compared to everyone else while comparing size in peace. These two rabbles are what we have now, and what have to be appeased.Updates after 2.3 left much to be desired. New voice overs for every class were added, leading to the reactions "WTF I LIKE THE OLD ONES" from the vets and "Oh cool, this game has voice acting" from the new guys. A new class was added, considered "lame and game breaking" by some and "easy to kill if you're not an idiot" buy others. Some old maps were taken out and put back in, leaving everyone to wonder where that balanced class was that was supposed to be added 3 patches ago. It seems nothing the poor devs can do makes anyone happy anymore for more than 2 seconds. The voices conflict each other 9 times out of ten, and it's a shame to see it all for nothing. So much love has been put into this project, that much is apparent just by booting it up and listening to the theme music. So why can't I give this game another chance? Why can't I find enjoyment in something so beautiful and unique and amazing since there's so much love smeared all over it? A while ago, the game released a ranged class. This was the first exclusivly ranged-focused class added to the game. The devs balanced the archer by handing out arrow blocking shields like expired candy to pretty much everyone else. It took some skill and getting used to before you could manage anything with it. Naturally, as change tends to do, everyone was enraged for one reason or another. The other guys saw the utility of this archer class and the new guys hated every second that they couldn't play one. A few updates later, a NEW ranged class was added to the game. You know what they forgot? Anti-ranged classes. And i don't mean classes that have a really good chance against archers when they're right on top of them. I mean some kind of stealth unit that can sneak up behind rangers and one-shot back stab them. Something that totally obliterates archers and sharpshooters when used by a competent player. Something that makes you NOT WANT TO PLAY A RANGED CLASS. Naturally, these units would be completely destroyed by melee units and thus you achieve balance.Now we run into the heart of the problem. We have a simple problem with a simple solution. Finish what was started, the world keeps spinning. But the problem isn't being solved. Updates have been excruciatingly slow, and depressing when they finally do get here. The most recent class, the Sharpshooter, isn't nearly as up-to-par as all of the other classes. Its another backpetalling archer with slightly more speed than you and seemingly unlimited ammunition. Without a counter class, my frustration with this game is doubled. Don't get me wrong, I like the idea of an Archer class and a Sharpshooter class and even the idea of having to find a way of dealing with them as a melee class. What i don't like is having to fight ranged classes and melee classes at the same time constantly. You've got two voices coming from the community. One says "U GUYS IM LIKE SUPR GUD AT RANGR YOLO420SWAGSNIPERWOLFNARUTO4EVER" and "No, it's easy. You've just got to use your shield and kite around this rock and run all the way around and wait until he's not paying attention and change classes 2 or 3 times and shoot him in the face. It's easy." (That is, IF you can hear them over the sound of errect ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ slapping against foreheads and keyboards.) I get it, you can get around them by kiting and shielding. I've done it many times. ITS NOT FUN.  I also get that you can start a fire with a stick and a rock, but that didn't stop matches from catching on. So two voices are left. Counter the rangers or don't counter the rangers. I get it, updates are in progress, these things take time blah blah blah, but the game play has been deteriorated. With a majority of the blocking mechanic has been practically removed and pure melee fighting nearly unheard of anymore, the melee combat is basic and unenjoyable. Balance it and i'll give it another try. Melee based games need fun melee combat.

content:
er 19, 2014
												Are you tired of dying to tryhards who's only excuse is to exploit every long range/ high damage weapon possible in Chivalry: Medieval Warfare?Are you tired to make one mistake and get your head chopped off due to a feint in the said game?Are you unsure if you'll manage to handle the largeness of Mount and Blade large-scale battles?(Actually have no experience in that area, but what the hell. )Anyway. This game, this booty-hoarding game, is a must for a sword clash loving player.3 time-line dominator individuals thrown together and battling with unique weapons and classes.Pirates are unfair and have guns and explosives, but they're frail, and are strongest when attacking together from alot of angles and causing mischief overall.Vikings are, pretty much, vikings, they'll be the ones who'll attack the front and mostly kill, but their main weapons are slow and they're easy to dispatch one at a time if they get separated.Knights are the most defensive based ones, having a fair share of close range weapons and long range archery, they gotta play together to survive, though, with the knights as the frontline and archers taking pot shots at the attackers.All classes have their unique sides in their play, as stated. All also have a special meter that fills up when causing enough damage, which can turn the tides of battles. (Like shooting a cannonball through a blunderbuss into a room filled with enemies and pretty much destroying the party!)Not the best review. 38 in-game hours don't say too much, but I learned some in my time cutting down enemies.This game is a must if one wanna have sword game. And downloading it free pretty much says it all in that matter.Oh, money, by the way.  This game is full of instant aquirement. number of helpful: 18 of 21 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
27, 2014
												Honestly, one of the best free-to-play HL2 mods out there, although with some stuff worth to mention.With a flowing and balanced melee system I've never seen anywhere, interesting classes and nice (and very fast!) gameplay, it truly earned it's place in my heart. People expecting quick updates will be disappointed: updates are made rarely, due to the developer team's small size. New classes are usually released per 2 years, while smaller updates take many months. While the developers obviously care about their game, the actual player population is rather small, made of around 200 players who faithfully play the game, and other random people who either stay, or get discouraged by the seemingly hard melee-system. The player count goes up exponentially when major updates are released, or during summer though.The only true negativities about the game is it's miniature community being composed of brain-dead people, but you can encounter nice people as well. Another thing is how high latency / ping can affect the reach of your melee weapons, meaning that people with 200 ms and the likes will prove to be a problem, both because of their lag making them harder to hit while their "longer" weapons make it much easier for them to hit you. Same thing happens with tw ats who decide to play around with their in-game rates via the console.Overall, I recommend the game. It really is a fun game to play, not easy to get into but if you  actually spend time playing and learning the melee system's mechanics it can be quite an enjoyable experience, minus the problems I've listed. Those can be off putting but try your best to ignore them.

number of helpful: 12 of 15 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
30, 2011
												This isn't exactly easy for me to write, and it sure as hell isn't going to be easy for the fans to read, so I'll start by listing what I love about PVKII. Its Chivalry-like combat system is novel and sometimes quite rewarding. It has a good sense of humor and a sense of place that adds to that humor, to the point where occasionally I found myself giggling while playing.The whole game is not only generally designed well, but looks and feels great, and it has a purity of form that you don't see often these days (rolling, kicking and certain achievements notwithstanding) - although it remains to be seen how the slow but steady updates will affect this going forward. The dedicated dev team who craft updates in their free time is yet another positive aspect. Community contributions to the game have been usually positive. At the very least, the mechanics of the game aren't stagnating somewhere they really shouldn't be. Player titles and parrot customization are both really cool. Basically, the game can be really fun at times.However, after more than a hundred hours of direct play over several years, and having gotten a number of friends into the game? I started to not only become increasingly frustrated, but I started seeing problems. Problems that aren't exactly fixable by developer manhours, problems which eventually turned me off the game, and they'll more than likely keep me away until or unless the game becomes wildly more popular than it is. It won't, and that is an honest damn shame, because PVKII has had - and continues to have - real passion and work put into it.I hate to say it, but a lot of those problems stem from the game's playerbase. The central issue is something called the prisoner's dilemma[en.wikipedia.org]. Since there are three teams that can all attack each other, it's possible for the two losing teams to fight each other instead of the winning team. Players often indiscriminately hunt and fight each other instead of ganging up on or even paying any attention to the winning team.Why? It's no real fault of the devs. This is a competitive multiplayer first-person mod with a not-insignificant difficulty curve made with an engine that's 12+ years old at this point. A small community and to a lesser extent players who ignore objectives are problems for ANY competitive multiplayer game, but here the situation is especially bad: a decent chunk of this game's small community seems hellbent on being deathmatchers and killfarmers who play into either the prisoner's dilemma or the apparently unacknowledged need for there to be an official and officially supported deathmatch version of bt_island, which is the de_dust of this game. A good helping of toxic gamer culture doesn't improve things.The problem with being decently skilled in this game is that the aforementioned decent chunk of the playerbase is still plain better than you on average, and you have a much steeper climb in front of you to hold your own against them. Teamwork is important in doing so, and it does happen sometimes! It's still not coordinated often due to the reasons in the above paragraph.Meanwhile, you're usually facerolling new players so hard I'd wager a good number of them would be roughed up enough to give the game a pass. This is a problem in every game with a small community, as I mentioned before, but here it's compounded by a number of factors. If this game could grab and sustain a critical mass of players, this wouldn't be nearly as much of an issue, but I cannot say it has the visibility or indeed the gameplay base to do so. It is a real shame.The achievements are both the icing on the cake and the red flag for me personally. Some of the more recent ones are ridiculous, especially going up against the usual crop of veterans, to the point where they're seemingly tailored for them. One of them is literally named 'Fifty Shades of Gestir', earned for using all of the Gestir's weapons to kill an opponent and unlocking the title of "The Fetishist", which I find utterly ridiculous yet strangely representative of the toxicity present in the community. A friend of mine outright told me that "the PVKII community has become so inbred that it's eating itself alive", and I'm sadly forced to agree!I want to like this game, and I want to recommend it, because it can definitely be fun. Unfortunately though, PVKII just proved more frustrating than I wanted to put up with, and for reasons that seemingly cannot be fixed anytime soon. I'm sorry, folks.

content:
18, 2013
												Swords, axes, crossbows, and rifles. You have three classic teams of old times, Pirates, Vikings, and Knights. The Pirates have their speedy skirmishers, tough captains, and a gun-happy sharpshooter. The Vikings have their insane yet fast berserkers, the powerfully defensive huscarl with his two handed axe and shield, and the gestir that pokes people with a spear. The Knights have your standard archer with both a longbow and a crossbow that's not quite so strong but is very quick, and they also have the heavy knight with his two handed sword can take out most enemies in just two or three hits.This is a great game for up close melee, but you do have to deal with the ranged classes and they can be very annoying from afar. But with your speedy sword swinging teammates, taking them down can be very easy depending on who you're fighting. Sure you have people that love to run away, and that's when it's best to have a ranged weapon to take them out from afar when they have their back turned trying desperately to run away from you. It's a great, fun, and crazy online game to play. It takes a while to master your sword swinging, parrying, and gunslinging, but it's well worth it when you're finally able to take down those really tough opponents. It's an all around enjoyable game that's not without its flaws, but still a great game especially for free. If you have the time to download it, I say get it. I rate this game a 7.5/10. Sure I want to rate it a 9/10, but I do recognize some of the game mechanics flaws particularly in balancing the three teams. Still I definitely recommend this game!

It plays like Chivalry, but runs well because it's not optimized all ♥♥♥♥-like. The classes are not all in the game yet (there are three for each team, but there are going to be more.) As of now, everything's balanced pretty well, the ranged classes not being as OP and easy to use as you'd expect. Overall, this game is amazing, and you should play it.

content:
ber 11, 2016
												Awesome game and the community is small but helpful!  I love the different teams and classes.  They feel well balanced and play to a certain play style.  The modes I played was last man standing where you have one life and fight till the last team is alive.  Being a 3 team battle, the fights were typically fun as you had to be strategetic.   Maps were decent sized for being on the source engine.  The capture the booty mode was way better.  3 bases in which you have to capture 6 pieces of treasure.   The treasure is used to lower your points on your team.  As more gold you optained for your team, the faster the number went down.  What's awesome is that you have a base (that relates to your team i.e. knights have a castle, vikings have a ship) and the game changes per what team you play.  The game is not perfect, it's buggy, the teams can definitly be stacked against you and the map cycles the same couple maps.  Install it and play it with some friends.  You'll have a blast!

content:
2, 2015
												I wish I could recommend this game to you. I really do. It certainly has a good amount of things going for it, however, there are some major drawbacks.1) There are only about 3 servers that have more than 5 people on them at any given time, which is a big problem in and of itself, but especially when you are bored of playing the Island map (there is a server that only uses Island), it can be frustrating.2) There is a pretty steep learning curve, especially if you plan on mastering all of the classes for all 3 factions. If you really cannot stand the learning curve, consider something like Age of Chivalry which is more geared to helping you learn the ins and outs of the game. 3) *sigh* this brings me to the maps. While some of the maps are good, as i said before, they can become very tedious very quickly. Rounds have a tendency to last longer than they really should (that goes for games too) and you might find yourself just spectating other players because you can't muster up the enthusiam to actually join the game. 4) My last point, and in my opinion by FAR the most important, is how awful the community can be. I have dealt with racism while playing other multiplayer games, but it usually just amounts to some 12 year old calling you a dirty n-word before he impales you. The difference between that, and what happens on PVK2 is that these are not twelve year olds, they are adults, and they aren't being racist to be funny, they are being racist because they are actually racist. I had to put up with a guy in a server who, through 2 or three seperate games, went on saying that whites are the superior race in every way, and every other race owes them something, along with a multitude of other vile, completely untrue statements. However, because there are no other servers and the Admin was away, I couldn't really do a thing about it.IN CLOSING, if you don't want to put up with  bad community, stale maps, a lack of servers, or just general boredom, don't bother putting too much time into it.

content:
8, 2014
												Though I enjoyed the game when I first started playing it 3 Years ago, I notice one thing that hasn't changed; the Community.Most players are decent and well and good, but there are, and yes this is true, still players using Aimbots on Archers.The Archer is already strong enough without a bot, and yes, there ARE Aimbots and Aim-Assists for Travel-Time projectile weapons, you can go ahead and spend a few minutes looking them up.The worst part about this sad factor of the Community is; there's only a few servers left that people actually play on, and they all have active admins.Active admins that don't do anything about Hackers or Botters and instead ban and kick the people getting upset about it and calling them out, always claiming the same old ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, "You can't aimbot a bow [Insultive Name]."  And that's usually followed by "Noob", "Gtfo", or an outright kick/ban/mute.  And if the admins don't have you banned for "Dumbass" or something of that note, prepare to be berated and verbally annihilated by all the good friends, admirers, and fellow Hackers of the Player in suspect when you say your piece about them.PVKII WOULD be fun, if not for the fact that the only way to HAVE ANY FUN if you aren't also using Hacks, is to find a way onto the Knights team and get Carried by Archerbots.Oh and believe me, the Ranged Combat for the Pirates?  Innacurate as hell and always a gamble.  You won't hit practically anything even point-blank.  And Vikings throw things, enough said.  Oh it's not?  The Travel time on a Javelin or Axe is so slow, that people will literally just keep strafing you and you'll miss half or all of your throws.So honest to goodness, unless you already plan to start off your PVKII experience using the latest and greatest Bot/Trainer/AimAssist, you're going to have a dumb, unfun time.Also, if you find yourself up against an Archer who has unbelievable skills, stand in their view and rapidly alternate your Strafe Left Strafe Right keys.  Notice how they'll immediately start missing almost every shot.  At you, someone who is physically standing still, yet has a Hitbox swerving all over the place.  You'll get what I'm talking about once you try this out.

content:
ber 5, 2014
												Recommended if you love Player vs. Player Deathmatch, TDM, CTF and steal the item type games (ie Team Fortress2) and If you own Half Life 2, get this mod game and play it.  This game has 3 Factions with male player avatars, and each competing  to win the round. There are NO Bots on servers.  Has in-game Voice chat.  Has No Matchmaking.Warning    You will see: backstabbing, spawn ganking, 2 faction in truce to gank another faction, players with inhuman games skills, crooked admins, players from other countries, elitist snobs, Trolls.  There is no protected areas to spawn to.  Has in-game voice chat so has no profanity protection and no profanity filter on text chat.  Beware of this playing on the current dedicated servers.This game has a fun sense of humor, steam acheivements and multiple weapon modes.Loaded this game on 4 sept 2014, worked fine, found a server and some people showed up to play some.  Good looking maps and avatars.  Melee combat is little hard to get used to.   Need some tutorials built in but just messing about, i figured out how to play.  Was rather fun and exciting.  Loaded the server on my other gaming computer and tried playing by myself all the maps on the server.  Has some community guides and website.  Devs have mentioned a third expansion in the works. Needs more people to play.  Need More dedicated internet servers to host and admin this game.  The devs need to fix the problem of spawn ganking on the next game expansion.  Great to host on your own LAN party server.

content:
ry 10, 2012
												Set in a dubious world, where, yes exactly, Pirates ; Vikings and Knights fight for... for what exactly? For gold, in the core gamemode, which plays like capture the flag meets domination. Or the upper hand in a trinket wars, which is mutated team death match (great maps in this mode! trap ridden aztec temples, nordic strongholds etc). But, what really makes PVKII a must try, are the unique melee combat mechanics. You can block in 4 different directions, attack in 4 different directions and accumulate hitting power by holding down the attack button. Then there are class based special abilities, which can be used after dealing enough damage. Such as a two handed whirlwind attack, a bomb firing blunderbuss, or just berserker rage. Adding the overall humorous scenario and custom made radio messages (they are just a blast!), PVK II is a great ride of fun. You like melee combat, or combating melee classes (no one likes archers though, especially with friendly fire on)?This game is for free! Get in there and join the killing spree.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 19, 2010
												A good mod, perhaps one of the rarests I'm playing in multiplayer.Back then, it was, now, I don't think I'll be coming back to it. And yet, the mod is very interesting: you can choose to be a pirate, a knight or a viking for a round. You have classes with special powers. Different modes existed, like a sort of CTF, deathmatch, etc..The graphics are from the Source engine, so, it was very nice. And each map could be related to each faction: old castle, docks, paradise island.At least, even if I wasn't a good player, I had fun being a knight or the pirate with the keg. The goal here isn't really a competitive one - you don't spawn in the same location, so you avoid campers.If the mod is still active, try it, I had a lot of fun.

content:
2, 2015
												After playing merely an hour of gameplay, I think I've come to a pretty reasonable conclusion.At first I thought to myself that if this game didn't have bots then I would really bother, but then I went on a multiplayer server and found out I was pretty good. Sadly when I booted up the game I found out that bots wasn't an option which is surprising since this is a source engine game and most source engine games have bots in them. Nevertheless, I was keen to find out what this game was all about. I picked a multiplayer server in the arena (since arenas are round and pretty basic so it wouldn't take much time for me to learn my surroundings, plus I saw it on a SeaNanners video) and I quickly caught onto how the combat works, bearing in mind this game doesn't have much of a tutorial, so the combat is pretty easy and quite fun and doesn't require a lot of skill, you just have to move around a bit and strike when the time is right. Although my kills were severely outweighed by my deaths I was still having fun and haven't managed to rage once (so I'm currently beating the record for most COD players.) The voice acting was laughable, and I don't mean that in a bad way, I mean it was hilarious to listen to how it sticks to the medieval stereotype warrior with it's sayings.Overall I would recommend this game to anyone, even with strangers it was pretty fun for my first time. Though the experience would be greatly enhanced when playing with friends.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
1, 2015
												Be a drunk-♥♥♥ Pirate, an manic pillaging Viking, or a prancing fool of a Knight as you fight your way though the other 2 teams of idiots over who's booze cup is the best. Kill your enemies with flatulence, taunts, and parrots as you try and take chests of booty from the other teams, and play as an angry furry, the taunting Frenchman, or the Black Knight while waiting for that perfect moment to use that badass special move you've been saving.One of the best things I found about this game is that each team has it's own specialty and feels very unique. The Pirates lack bulky classes and do poorly in fair fights. To make up for this, Pirates don't get into fair fights. Vikings are very fast and  on average, quite hardy and can deal considerable amounts of damage very quickly. However, they can be easily taken down with some harassed damage and avoiding a direct fight. The Knights, when working as a team, are generally more powerful than the other teams. Thier biggest weakness is their individual classes, which all have massive and easily exploitable flaws.Overall, a brilliant game with a few flaws:-Ocasionally, it can be pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t-Due to the game being a hobby for the devs, it is updated VERY slowly (It's been in beta since 2007)-A few days ago, a French YouTuber with 4.2 million subscribers made a video on the game, and all of the servers are completely full, the ones that aren't full, people there can't understand me anyway-Before the servers became totally full of the French, the only people who played were deathmatchers who refused to play on any map but bt_island (A good map, but any map gets boring after 80 constant hours)That's about all I have to say. Play this game now. Right now. Stop reading this review. Go! Now!9.4/10

content:
10, 2014
												This game is great. In some ways it's even better than Team Fortress 2. You get three teams: Pirates, Vikings and Knights, and each of those teams are fun to play as, and they all have their different characters with different personalities, including different and quite interesting weapons, such as claymores, pistols and throwing axes. I really recommend this game if you're a multiplayer FPS fan. Better yet... it's an FPS set in the 1500-1700's. Now that is some epic ♥♥♥♥ right there.Better yet, it's free!

В игре много режимов, забавная графика и необычный геймплей (ведь в игре сразу 3 стороны - Пираты, Викинги и Рыцари). У каждой стороны свои классы и обычно этих классов по 2-3 человека (у рыцарей 2). Мне лично нравятся пираты, так как можно натравить своего попугая на врага, когда играешь капитаном пиратов). Краски в игре слишком красочные, но это и +. Игра бесплатная, это ей даёт большой плюс (8,1/10)

												Hello Fellow Warriors,I enjoy Pirates, Viking, and Knights II! It's mechanics and hit boxes can be a little broken at times, but it's a lot of fun! A free to play, team-based game that is a lot of fun. In all honesty, though, if the game cost money I wouldn't recommend it and that's only because it can get frustrating pretty quickly or pretty boring pretty quickly. The game itself doesn't have a great community as there are a lot of people just looking for a reaction left playing this game, but finding a server with a decent amount of players on it in the first place is a challenge. I recommend it, sure, but only because it's free and it's a  great game for what it's supposed to be! Definitely worth downloading it, especially if you have friends to play it with!-Kyle James

y 14, 2013
												What more could you want than Pirates, Vikings, and Knights(each with multiple classes) duking it out in a 3 way capture the flag? Pirates have guns and killer parrots, Vikings have less ranged attacks but are far superior in melee, and the Knights have good ranged classes and good melee classes. This is also the best melee system I have ever seen implemented into an FPS view. Did I mention 3-way Capture the Flag!?

The community is small, but dedicated.

content:
r 30, 2014
												You see, 1242,9 hrs record since versions 1.0-2.5 (when I stopped playing, because of reasons), but 3.0 is coming today, so I'll hope it lures me back to play it once again.This game is worth of playing over 1000 hours. Problem is, that you may not like some things. Too many shiny effects, or class-related things. And this game needs seriously more players to play. PVKII needs you!Simple game mechanics and combat, easy to learn. Combat mechanics, map changes & balance changes in every update to upside down, so you'll never get bored! And this mod is totally made of bare hands of people, who make this in their free time.Want to play like zweihänder as heavy armored knight?Legolas-styled archer with fire arrows, or sniper-crossbow?Slammer man-at-arms?Heavy hitting rage-berserker? (was my favorite, until they "nefred" it to become runner and light-hitter and made me quit)Strong-all-ground huskarl?An annoying old man, gestir?More annoying skirmisher-pirate, with throwing explosive kegs?Kaptain with attack parrots and blunderbuss, which can shoot cannonballs?Sharpshooter...sniper?This game doesn't take too seriously on history-relation, but it is (at least was. Maybe it is still, I haven't played since 2.5) entertaining.Edit: so, 3.0 is here, and so stays skirmishing berserker. Too low range for two-handed axe (it is like normal sword) and low damage. Not suitable for brute-viking. That's why I give thumb down.

content:
, 2013
												Pirates, Vikings and Knights II is a multiplayer team-based FPS mod.The mod features three different classes. There are greedy pirates, vicious vikings and chivalric knights. All fighting each other at the same time, it is a great mix of different eras and all classes have their respective weaponry. The pirates have pistols and access to gunpowder, whilst the vikings and knights rely on older technology.PVK2 is a colorful mod with detailed graphics. The character models and weapons look fantastic and have good animations.In my opinion is Pirates, Vikings and Knights II one of the best multiplayer source mods and it will bring many hours of fun to you and your friends.Sounds 7/10Graphics 8/10Gameplay 8/10Atmosphere 8/10If you liked my review, please feel free to follow me and/or my curator group:http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ov3RT4K3R/myworkshopfiles/?section=guideshttp://steamcommunity.com/groups/orcollective#curationAlso feel free to check out my YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC83DYCmrWfl9ttrhX54jmWA

30, 2015
												If i were to choose the best HL2 mod, i would choose pvkii.Everything in this game is so amazing, so unique and fun. It blows me away it's a "mod"!The melee system is unremarkable, the physics are awesome and the classes are very amusing, and all of them have very unique playstyles!! Not only this, the developers of the game are REALLY cool and handsome people. Everyone should give this game a try, even if it looks "eh, okay..."  at first, once you play it and become good at it you can have the time of your life! Sadly, there's no toturial and the learning curve becomes EXTREMELY difficult, since it's just trial and error.  Which is rather bad for new players, but it's really the only problem...Nothing is way "too" unbalanced, and the game is fun either way.I won't say anything else.. But i came up with this in case you want a fast review.TL;DR :  Choose Pirates, Choose Vikings, Choose Knights... But whatever you choose.. Choose P,V,K  i i

content:
ry 24
												When I was a young child I watched Lazy Town, and they preached the fact that "Yar har, fiddle di dee, Being a pirate is all right with me, Do what you want 'cause a pirate is free,". I always followed these teachings as if they were the benelovent fact from the gods above. I was a sheep of society. I decided to educate myself, figure out: Is it really alright with me? Am I truly free as a Pirate? Yar har, fiddle di dee? I installed this game quickly chosing the Pirate captain. I spent the next 27.1 hours of my life straight playing as a Pirate Captain. Thats when I realized, I was not to be shamed of being a sheep, as a Pirate I truly was free! After the first few minutes I quickly realized I had in my arsenal a secret weapon. Like the hydrogen bombs dropped upon Hiroshima, I had the weapon to end all wars. I pressed "3" on my keyboard; and there they were. Polly,  your personal trusty parrot. With a click of my mouse, I had one the game... Polly flew out into battle, barging directly into a duel between a knight and a viking. Before they realized what hit them they all died. Their eyes resembled grandma's good ol' jars of raspberry jam. I set forward my peg leg, sprinting towards the tall gates of the castle. I could not believe my eyes (fireflys); spread out among the courtyard 9 bodies of vikings, and knights. I glance to the top-right of my screen and there I saw the glowing red killfeed sprawled across my screen telling tales of my glorious combat. Polly returns to me, having finished her work in murdering the enemies inside of their own spawns to the point until they were forced to leave. I entered the keep of the castle, I grabbed a oak chest, its gold spilling out of its sides. I took that gold and walked into the sunset with Polly... Yar.. Har... Fiddly di dee... I am a pirate, and I am truly free...[VAC BANNED | Pirates, Vikings, and Knights II]

												This game is just the best. I can't find another better game. Even TF2 can't compare (In my personal opinion) to this. This game really a lot of fun, the voice lines are hilarious, the combat is genious, and the maps are amazing. I don't know why the playerbase is continuing to be french if this game is free, I guess kids these days don't look well enough or they just don't want to improve on this game, but really, this game is just to pull your competitive spirit out but not turning you into a silent tryhard. Overall, this game is so amazing, it never wears out because there are servers that host custom maps. At first, the combat may seem difficult, but the more you play it, the better you get, just like any other multiplayer PvP game. This game is a must-have for anyone that likes melee combat.

content:
0, 2015
												A fun game. Different maps have different goals. Arena is a "Last Man Standing" ( Last Team Standing ) map. My favourite game mode is on Booty Island: the Knights start off with 6 treasure chests. If they hold them for long enough, they win the game. The Vikings and Pirates try and steal the treasure chests and bring them back to their hideouts. There is a countdown timer, so you are on the clock. Picking up a chest from the enemy base and throwing it, will delay the clock. Which is why you see me picking up chests and throwing them into the ocean, as a denial tactic. This game is for the mischievous.The game has the same mechanics as Chivalry: Medieval Warfare, which makes me think that Torn Banner ( Chivalry ) borrowed the game mechanics. PVKII has faster running speed, slightly less finesse but not necessarily less tactical complexity - the battlefield is mayhem. What's refreshing is that there are no cheese / exploit mechanics like in Chivalry. I have 333 hours in Chivalry, so I'm not saying that Chivalry is a bad game, Chivalry just has some high end exploits that advanced players like to use ( duck + 180 degree spin swing. Honestly duck should be taken out of the game. ).PVKII is a fun casual game ( casual in the sense that games take 2-6 minutes to play. There are hardcore players in the game ). You only need a few players on each team, to play a game, so don't let the low player count deter you.

er 19, 2014
												I love this game so much, It had some balance issues that have been fixed over time. Not to mention that although this game is not constantly being updated, but when it is the update is large including maps or even a new character to play. PVKII has similar elements to Chivalry but it mixes in to make a fun game, although it does require some skill. In PVKII you have the Choice of 3 teams: Pirates, Vikings, and of course; Knights. There are many different game-modes and to name a few:* Booty - A Capture-The-Flag type game-mode, which has the 3 teams fighting over chests and having chests make your points count down, the more you have the faster it counts down.*Trinket Wars - The three teams pit off against each other in a team death-match scenario except one player in each team is super powered as they hold the teams "Trinket". The Super powered player will regen any team-mates near them as well as heal themselves, but if they die they drop the trinket and you have to pick it up before it disappears Overall a brilliant game for it being free 10/10.

content:
ber 25, 2015
												Positive Review:If you always wanted to play Chivalry: Medieval Warfare but never had the money to buy it, then this game is for you... its very much like Chivalry, but with Pirates and Vikings added to it, mind you there are some things this game has that Chivalry doesn't and vise versa the game is pretty well polished, maybe the hit detection is a bit off and the servers are not the greatest when it comes to ping, but the game delivers on the fun factor. As for cash shop or anything of the sorts, i didn't reall see one which in my opinion makes the game good by far. except ----vNegative Review:As i mentioned above this, the hit detection is quite a bit off and can be quite annoying, and also there is the server problem, i picked the server that has good ping "or so it says" and when i joined everyone has 150 - 300 ping... making it almost impossible to hit anyone.... but everyone can hit you...another problem with the servers... they are pretty much empty... now idk if it is because im US East or not, but there were only 3 games out of....50 servers? give or take 10.... 1 had 6 players, 1 had 2 and one "which had the worst ping" had 26 players.... i tried them all, and i could hardly kill anyone, out of my 0.7 hrs of play i got 3 kills or something around that and north of 20 deaths... i know maybe i could just suck at the game...true, but my chiv record says otherwise.personal thoughts only:I didn't mind the game, but it's not for me... I'll stick with Chiv, but don't let this have you shy away from the game, no no no... give it a try this is just my personal thoughts, if the game looks interesting to you, go ahead and download it, it doesn't cost you anything and there is no cash shop as i mentioned. who knows you might be really good and love the game.

												I played this game a long time ago and came back to it, wondering why I stopped playing, and now I remember. The game is plagued with horribly unbalanced teams. Unless you're a Skirmisher, Sharpshooter, or Archer, you can expect most of your game time to be spent chasing after said enemies who can damage AS they outrun you, and they will. Maybe once in a while, you'll get a good actual fight in, but the times you spend being frustrated just overtakes it. It's fun if you can play with a bunch of friends who would abuse this imbalance, but otherwise I definately won't be coming back until this is fixed.

content:
ber 7, 2015
												5/10 didn't find it very fun at all despite my positive bias for the genre, but I'm sure it's fun for someone out there.You may stand to have a good time if you've never played Mount and Blade or Chivalry. It does feel as though the game was made with love, but it's still an awkward, clumsy, and unpolished combat experience. I'm easily satisfied when it comes to melee combat but this game was actually hard to enjoy. Fights are just people running around each other swinging and swinging and swinging their awkward weapons until they die. They're long and unfulfilling.If you're using one of the weapons worth using (as in, non-ranged and not one in which you hold down the attack button to repeat the little "chop-chop" animation), you look in a direction to choose which of your three attacks you're going to do, and there the weapon stays for as long as you hold that button. The idea is this "charges" your attacks, which is a welcome mechanic, but all it does is slow down your attacking. There is no flow, no comboing, no way to mix it up. You have three attacks that won't ever change and they're all made for a very small hitbox. You really can't drag it around either as you can in the aforementioned games, leaving you feel less like a warrior and more like a theme park robot. And in the event you raise up a fully charged attack, know that you aren't going to kill anyone. Everyone has what is effectively a dual health bar - one for health and the other for "armor" - and you'll be hacking at even an archer for quite a while before they die because of it. Seriously... You'll take your greataxe, walk up to an archer with a fully charged attack, bring it down on their head, and they'll just look at you like you were stupid to try it. Then they just walk away as you try to hit them the 3-4 more times it takes to kill them.There exists a parry system like that of mount and blade, in that you must look a certain direction to ready the right parry. It's potentially nice if you have the presence of mind to use it, but in all likelihood, your opponent is going to miss that attack that you're prepared for, and most fights are just exchanges of swings. Parrying only seems worth it if you're incredibly practiced at it, and if you're using it in a duel, otherwise you just want to get out as much hitting as possible.Everyone is appropriately mobile, at least. The base run speed is quite fast and perfect as such, and everyone has a nifty little roll they can execute, although I'm unsure of how applicable it really is in a fight. You can't roll and transition smoothly into an attack.Are the teams balanced? I haven't played enough to say for sure, but it seems the pirates generally come out on top. In a game where hitting people to death is a tedious experience, the characters that can just shoot you as well as place powerful explosives are probably going to have an edge.

												I personally can't recommend this game. The sword fighting is a rather perimitive charge-up style, which lacks skill. You just release left click when they're near you, or block. If you want this game because you like medieval stuff, then look at Mount & Blade: Bannerlord, which still has the charge up style fighting, but it takes more timing and its much more balanced and fun, and replicates the medieval aspect in a much more fun, realistic, and involving way.

10, 2015
												This game is TERRIBLEHit Boxes are off, weapons are unbalanced, and the game just does so much of the wrong stuff. They try and make the game realistic by making a shield brake system and faction based classes, but then they fly off the reality track and make rifles 5 shot kills and swords are 10 hits.As far as balance goes, dudes with diamond armor and 30ft. longswords plauge the game killing everything that moves, while guys with shortswords and shields struggle to see over their shield, and when they hit, its barely even noticed.Ultimately, my rating for this game is a 4 out of ten, painfully average. it would've been lowered to maybe a 3 had it not been for the hilarious fart trick and the somewhat attractive gunplay.

content:
ber 6, 2016
												Played five matches, at different times of the week. All children, with the most dreadful multiplayer manners. I thoroughly enjoyed the original, and because it required a base purchase of half-life it wasn't populated by the dregs of humanity. Not the case here.The game itself hasn't strayed far from the original formula, lots of polish on the characters, while the maps are hideous and cartoony. The game modes are a great idea, I'm sure they'd be fun with the right crowd.I can't really fault the devs for the actions of their community, it wasn't any aspect of their design that turned me off from this title. I'll probably come back to check up on it.Not recommended for a solo player to drop in to. Probably great light-hearted fun killing friends.From an active, contributing member of this game's community:It's not even the developers fault that PNVs (Pathetic Nostalgic Veterans) miss the "old game"
You're pathetic "in my eyes" because you're heavily comparing the original with this one. 
-♥♥♥♥♥rto el NegroPlease note how previous experience with the developers' work makes you inferior in the eyes of the community.

												According to all known lawsof aviation, there is no way a beeshould be able to fly. Its wings are too small to getits fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway because bees don't carewhat humans think is impossible. Yellow, black. Yellow, black.Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Ooh, black and yellow!Let's shake it up a little. Barry! Breakfast is ready! Ooming! Hang on a second. Hello? - Barry?- Adam? - Oan you believe this is happening?- I can't. I'll pick you up. Looking sharp. Use the stairs. Your fatherpaid good money for those. Sorry. I'm excited. Here's the graduate.We're very proud of you, son. A perfect report card, all B's. Very proud. Ma! I got a thing going here. - You got lint on your fuzz.- Ow! That's me! - Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000.- Bye! Barry, I told you,stop flying in the house! - Hey, Adam.- Hey, Barry. - Is that fuzz gel?- A little. Special day, graduation. Never thought I'd make it. Three days grade school,three days high school. Those were awkward. Three days college. I'm glad I tooka day and hitchhiked around the hive. You did come back different. - Hi, Barry.- Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. - Hear about Frankie?- Yeah. - You going to the funeral?- No, I'm not going. Everybody knows,sting someone, you die. Don't waste it on a squirrel.Such a hothead. I guess he could havejust gotten out of the way. I love this incorporatingan amusement park into our day. That's why we don't need vacations. Boy, quite a bit of pomp...under the circumstances. - Well, Adam, today we are men.- We are! - Bee-men.- Amen! Hallelujah! Students, faculty, distinguished bees, please welcome Dean Buzzwell. Welcome, New Hive Oitygraduating class of... ...9:15. That concludes our ceremonies. And begins your careerat Honex Industries! Will we pick ourjob today? I heard it's just orientation. Heads up! Here we go. Keep your hands and antennasinside the tram at all times. - Wonder what it'll be like?- A little scary. Welcome to Honex,a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you, as a bee,have worked your whole life to get to the point where youcan work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant PollenJocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top-secret formula is automatically color-corrected,scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctivegolden glow you know as... Honey! - That girl was hot.- She's my cousin! - She is?- Yes, we're all cousins. - Right. You're right.- At Honex, we constantly strive to improve every aspectof bee existence. These bees are stress-testinga new helmet technology. - What do you think he makes?- Not enough. Here we have our latest advancement,the Krelman. - What does that do?- Oatches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it.Saves us millions. Oan anyone work on the Krelman? Of course. Most bee jobs aresmall ones. But bees know that every small job,if it's done well, means a lot. But choose carefully because you'll stay in the jobyou pick for the rest of your life. The same job the rest of your life?I didn't know that. What's the difference? You'll be happy to know that bees,as a species, haven't had one day off in 27 million years. So you'll just work us to death? We'll sure try. Wow! That blew my mind! "What's the difference?"How can you say that? One job forever?That's an insane choice to have to make. I'm relieved. Now we only haveto make one decision in life. But, Adam, how could theynever have told us that? Why would you question anything?We're bees. We're the most perfectlyfunctioning society on Earth. You ever think maybe thingswork a little too well here? Like what? Give me one example. I don't know. But you knowwhat I'm talking about. Please clear the gate.Royal Nectar Force on approach. Wait a second. Oheck it out. - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!- Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's likeoutside the hive. Yeah, but some don't come back. - Hey, Jocks!- Hi, Jocks! You guys did great! You're monsters!You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it! - I wonder where they were.- I don't know. Their day's not planned. Outside the hive, flying who knowswhere, doing who knows what. You can'tjust decide to be a PollenJock. You have to be bred for that. Right. Look. That's more pollenthan you and I will see in a lifetime. It's just a status symbol.Bees make too much of it. Perhaps. Unless you're wearing itand the ladies see you wearing it. Those ladies?Aren't they our cousins too? Distant. Distant. Look at these two. - Oouple of Hive Harrys.- Let's have fun with them. It must be dangerousbeing a Pollen Jock. Yeah. Once a bear pinned meagainst a mushroom! He had a paw on my throat,and with the other, he was slapping me! - Oh, my!- I never thought I'd knock him out. What were you doing during this? Trying to alert the authorities. I can autograph that. A little gusty out there today,wasn't it, comrades? Yeah. Gusty. We're hitting a sunflower patchsix miles from here tomorrow. - Six miles, huh?- Barry! A puddle jump for us,but maybe you're not up for it. - Maybe I am.- You are not! We're going 0900 at J-Gate. What do you think, buzzy-boy?Are you bee enough? I might be. It all dependson what 0900 means. Hey, Honex! Dad, you surprised me. You decide what you're interested in? - Well, there's a lot of choices.- But you only get one. Do you ever get boreddoing the same job every day? Son, let me tell you about stirring. You grab that stick, and you justmove it around, and you stir it around. You get yourself into a rhythm.It's a beautiful thing. You know, Dad,the more I think about it, maybe the honey fieldjust isn't right for me. You were thinking of what,making balloon animals? That's a bad jobfor a guy with a stinger. Janet, your son's not surehe wants to go into honey! - Barry, you are so funny sometimes.- I'm not trying to be funny. You're not funny! You're goinginto honey. Our son, the stirrer! - You're gonna be a stirrer?- No one's listening to me! Wait till you see the sticks I have. I could say anything right now.I'm gonna get an ant tattoo! Let's open some honey and celebrate! Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.Shave my antennae. Shack up with a grasshopper. Geta gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"! I'm so proud. - We're starting work today!- Today's the day. Oome on! All the good jobswill be gone. Yeah, right. 												القرآن)، ولا تتم الصلاة (وعبادات أخرى) في الإسلام إلا بإتقان بعض العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير من أهم الأعمال الدينية والفكرية اليهودية في العصور الوسطى. وأثّر انتشار الإسلام، وتأسيسه دولاً، في ارتفاع مكانة اللغة العربية، وأصبحت لغة السياسة والعلم والأدب لقرون طويلة في الأراضي التي حكمها المسلمون، وأثرت العربية تأثيراً مباشراً أو غير مباشر على كثير من اللغات الأخرى في العالم الإسلامي، كالتركية والفارسية والأمازيغية والكردية والأردوية والماليزية والإندونيسية والألبانية وبعض اللغات الإفريقية الأخرى مثل الهاوسا والسواحيلية والتجرية والأمهرية و الصومالية، وبعض اللغات الأوروبية وخاصةً المتوسطية كالإسبانية والبرتغالية والمالطية والصقلية، كما أنها تُدرَّس بشكل رسمي أو غير رسمي في الدول الإسلامية والدول الإفريقية المحاذية للوطن العربي. العربية لغة رسمية في كل دول الوطن العربي إضافة إلى كونها لغة رسمية في تشاد وإريتريا وإسرائيل. وهي إحدى اللغات الرسمية الست في منظمة الأمم المتحدة، ويُحتفل باليوم العالمي للغة العربية في يسمبركذكراعتماد العربية بين لغات العمل في الأمم المد واللغة العربية من أغزر اللغات من حيث المادة اللغوية، فعلى سبيل المثال يحوي معجم لسان العرب لابن منظور من القرن الثالث عشر أكثر من ألف مادة، بينما في اللغة الإنجليزية فإن قاموس صموئيل جونسون وهو من أوائل من وضع قاموساً إنجليزياً من القرن الثامن عشر يحتوي على ألف كلم تحتوي العربية على حرفاً مكتوباً. ويرى بعض اللغويين أنه يجب إضافة حرف الهمزة إلى حروف العربية، ليصبح عدد الحرو تُكتب العربية من اليمين إلى اليسار - ومثلها اللغة الفارسية والعبرية وعلى عكس الكثير من اللغات العالمية - ومن أعلى الصفحة إلى أسفلها. العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير

2, 2016
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and it destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

er 4, 2016
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this F**king Game gave me cancer anyway.

content:
er 9, 2014
												While I used to like this game, and was somewhat good at it, I can no longer play it. The recent patch made a huge improvement in grafics, and added the last class of the original game to the line-up (namely the Man-at-Arms), but it also caused the game to be unplayable for those who don't have a computer made for games. Before the patch, the grafics were somewhat bad, but the game ran smooth and worked without problems. But now, the new grafics causes a lag which makes your attacks miss. If you have a older computer, or a computer not optimized for games, don't bother with this game. I give the game before the patch 9/10 and the game after the patch 5/10.

content:
r 31, 2014
												Sloppy coding, incompetent developed decisions, SEVERELY unbalanced class design (as the oodles and oodles and oodles of map and weapon changes over the years have tried desperately to make not AS bad, but you just can't fix something that wasn't meant to be made in the first place), over-abundance of unnecessary community splicing (I.E. giving some players access to a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ beta while ignoring the rest when in fact what was being "beta-tested" was releasable in terms of the terrible quality the mod already had going for it anyway), and a HEARTY amount of community theft. Stealing maps from ex-devs who left years ago, but claiming it a NEW map (check the REAL author for tortuga and when it was made, you will find it was created around 6 years before it was actually released as a "new map"), constantly desperate to take maps made by the community and make them official so the dev team can avoid doing any real work, even if said maps don't fit the theme in the slightest, or are fugly as hell and need dozens of revisions (which plenty of the official maps already get anyway which says a lot about their confidence in the first place) and to top it all off, the dev team has had a LOAD of behind-the-scenes drama with each other AND its own community. The biggest of these countless examples would probably be them giving the finger to the ORIGINAL CREATOR OF PIRATES, VIKINGS AND KNIGHTS on the goldsource engine, ultimately showing zero respect for authors of ACTUAL creativity (as is still practiced by them with their map theft and content-copying) considering the majority of everything created was based off of someone else's work, including multiple maps, biggest example obviously being bt_island. Avoid this ♥♥♥♥ at all costs. It is garbage, and is made by the embodiment of quite the same. Anyone who has gotten cozy with this mod for longer than a year prior will know this very well, and thati s why its playerbase has died off for very very VERY good reasons.

content:
er 19, 2010
												To many players, the title was all it took. It's still in progress so balance is not finely tuned, and it can be frustrating when other players take teams x and y first leaving the game unbalanced or you stuck with team z for the tenth game in a row ... ballacing is a lot more complicated with three teams than with two. But the melee combat is excellant, with a nice, simple attack/block mechanic. And there are attack parrots. I don't think any other game has attack parrots, vikiing Seaxes and castles in one little package. Multiplayer only, but loads of fun.
